result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AMENDED - Court orders cash bond be reinstated and the bond money be returned to the surety.  It is the intent of this Order that the Defn remain in custody on the cash bond previously set unless and until he or someone else posts the bond on his behalf.  All other conditions remain the same.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 7

IN CUSTODY

08:47 AM Defendant Devin M Crayton in court with attorney Kara M Rolf. Prosecuting Atty Hector Al-Homsi appeared for State of Wisconsin. State calls law enforcement, duly sworn. Direct by the State.  Witness id'd DE.  Cross examination by Atty Rolf. Redirect.  State moves for bindover, reserves argument.  Defense objects with argument.   State's argument.  CT finds PC that felony was commited, binds case over.
Atty Kara Rolf, appointed 1/19/2021
Zoom
Preliminary hearing on January 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jurate S, Dalia S, or Vitaljus S. 
- Defendant shall not be on Ians Way in Madison. 
- Defendant shall not operate any motor vehicle not registered to the defendant without written consent from the lawful owner on their person. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
